# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_length = 0
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        # Check if adding the next word exceeds the maximum width
        if current_length + word_length > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_length = 0
        end
        # Add space before the word if it's not the beginning of the line
        if current_length > 0
            wrapped_text *= " "
            current_length += 1
        end
        wrapped_text *= word
        current_length += word_length
    end
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "Julia is great for numerical and technical computing"
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This `wrap_string` function iterates over words in the provided text, wrapping lines so that no line exceeds the specified maximum text width (default is 10 characters). It adds a newline character each time the addition of a new word would make the current line longer than this limit.
